item.title: [PI] Kick Command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

if (command.startsWith("kick") { client noob = null; for(int i = 0; i < server.playerHandler.players.length; i++){ if(server.playerHandler.players[i] != null){ if(command.substring(5).equalsIgnoreCase(server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName)){ noob = (client)server.playerHandler.players[i]; noob.disconnected = true; noob.logoutButton = true; } } } }
Quick code I snipped up, check it out (I couldn’t be bothered to put player rights in).

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Kick Command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Mariokillu Mariokillu
item.description:
@Mariokillu wrote:

Ix Soulcist xI:

You do realize the kick command is suppose to log a member out and then allow them back in?

You do realize that reading someones post before posting is the way to go.

Yes, Sherlock, I am aware of that. I said that is dc’s them then AUTOMATICALLY (keyword there) logs them back in.

Get it? Good.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Kick Command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Mariokillu Mariokillu
item.description:
@Mariokillu wrote:

I’ve had this problem for quite a while but never got it fixed.

When I use this command

           		if (playerCommand.startsWith("kick") && c.playerRights >= 1) {

		    		Client noob = null;
                	for (int i = 0; i < Server.playerHandler.players.length; i++){
				if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null){
							if(playerCommand.substring(5).equalsIgnoreCase(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName)){
						noob = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i];
							Server.playerHandler.players[i].disconnected = true;
						}
					}
				}
            		}

It only dc’s them but automatically logs them back in

And when I use

           		if (playerCommand.startsWith("kick") && c.playerRights >= 1) {

		    		Client noob = null;
                	for (int i = 0; i < Server.playerHandler.players.length; i++){
				if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null){
							if(playerCommand.substring(5).equalsIgnoreCase(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName)){
						noob = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i];
							Server.playerHandler.players[i].properLogout = true;
						}
					}
				}
            		}

It does nothing.

Any ideas?

Read full topic
